title: Agathamay
author: Agathamay
content: I thought the group would like this...        Let me start by appreciating our leader's and readers,both have tremendous impacts on man's life.        Leaders learn principles to carry on a task,this process is achieved through reading.when this habits is inculcated your mindset is influenced and improved in the society as well.Thus a leader  is a person who leads and have authority to direct.Oxford dictionary will.have it that a reader is a person who reads and recites,but it's a way far beyond that because readers are influencers of what they read.when you read your intellectually inclined and informed,so in order to be a good leader you need to invest a maxi percentage in reading and developing yourself to carry on the task at hand.    Here a Clarified difference of both is that;                                                                             A Reader think to Grow while                                                                              A Leader read to lead.Fortunately,we can learn the keys to success from both perception.the books you read motivates and lay impacts on you.you can't be a good leader intellectually wise if your not a good reader. Let me drive it to this forum now,if we don't read to get informed of a knowledge we end up being deformed.A leader can also be a good reader in the sense that he has assimilated a positive reading habits which has developed and impacted him.and thus making it his lifestyle.and again,not all leaders are readers because they want to bear a name without making a name.In conclusion,I'm urging that a good Leader-reading habits can be achieved by effectively analysing and practising what you've assimilated while reading,and accomplishing it.having done this;this is when good praises and honour are given to the leader's from their subject's because here now he has read,think,grow,and acted.So I advice we all should inculcate a good reading habits to develop ourselves and society.

comments.author: Lordhermes
comments.body: If you adopt the Platonic definition of leadership, readers are leaders. One must have completed both formal and informal education in order to be a leader. A leader must be a proficient reader in order to be outspoken. Readers dominate the world, and leaders who promote reading have a deeper understanding of their subjects' cultures, histories, and environments. If you watch the leaders of different nations, especially those who are performing openly, you will notice that they are all readers. Reading is what makes a man, and leaders need to be exposed to new ideas, skills, knowledge, and ways of thinking. Reading enlightening books can provide leaders with fresh perspectives on how to govern their subjects. Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers, according to Harry S. T. Truman.

comments.author: Tallupooh
comments.body: A just and wise leader, is a very good leader. If the leader was a reader, that would be the right combination. By reading, it will increase his insight, and become a better leader. People who like to read, their knowledge will be wider, and insightful. Adds a high level of empathy for his subordinates. In that way, the leader will become more self-aware of himself. And keep his people will always always be peaceful and prosperous.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: A leader must be a reader in other for him to have new initiatives and broaden his knowledge on how to lead his people. Reading can solve so many problems as a leader. We have two types of leaders which are good leaders and bad leaders. A good leader is the one that reads, understand and put his knowledge into practice but a bad leader is the one that reads,understand but do not practice what he has read. That is why some leaders fail in their leadership, they turn the other way round instead of doing the right thing because of some personal or selfish interest. Practising what you have read brings out the best of you.

comments.author: Marcellin9
comments.body: It is vitally important to view ourselves clearly in society. No matter what position we have in a company or a group, we should be very careful with our own positioning. Leaders are born with certain charisma and ability and they are the ones who lead a team. Readers don't necessarily have to be simple followers but when disagreements happen to come, most of team members must listen to and obey leaders in order to make sure the whole team is going smoothly. There is no big deal what role we have as long as the result is positive.
